title: 7 Easy-to-Make Thanksgiving Recipes
author: Chino Valley Ranchers
content:
Thanksgiving is just a few days away and if you haven’t finalized your menu yet, here are a few recipes you should consider.

  1. Thanksgiving Deviled Eggs

Keep your Thanksgiving guests out of the kitchen as you make the finishing touches to your main dishes by distracting them with these creamy deviled eggs. For this recipe, you’ll need one dozen Chino Valley Ranchers eggs, one tablespoon of unsalted butter, one small shallot, 1 ½ tablespoons of chopped fresh sage leaves, four slices of bacon, ⅓ cup mayonnaise, one tablespoon of Dijon mustard, ½ teaspoon salt, and freshly ground black pepper.

View the full recipe here.

  1. Turkey-Filled Omelette

The day after Thanksgiving, if you want to incorporate leftovers into breakfast, here’s a great turkey-filled omelette recipe. A few key ingredients include shitake mushroom, shallot, turkey, eggs, and creme fraiche.

View the full recipe here.

  1. Turkey Bacon Egg Sandwich

With two slices of bread, turkey bacon, cheese, tomato, egg, and arugula, you can quickly put together this sandwich for lunch or breakfast.

View the full recipe here.

  1. Thanksgiving Eggnog Pie

Even if you have family members who aren’t big fans of eggnog, this recipe has a few key ingredients that are sure to make it a favorite at your Thanksgiving meal. For this recipe, you’ll need gingersnap crumbs, butter, vanilla pudding, eggnog, heaving whipping cream, and vanilla.

View the full recipe here.

  1. Thanksgiving Breakfast Frittata

If Thanksgiving dinner doesn’t wear you out, and you’re in the mood for a yummy frittata, then you’ve got to try out this recipe. Ingredients include butternut squash, shallot, mushrooms, eggs, egg whites, milk, and seasoning.

View the full recipe here.

  1. Thanksgiving Eggs Benedict

This spin on eggs benedict features a waffle made out of stuffing, topped with sliced roasted turkey, a poached egg, and hollandaise sauce. Serve with leftover cranberry sauce for an extra flavor boost.

View the full recipe here.

  1. Turkey and Egg Breakfast Casserole

Create this dish with ground turkey and a few vegetables. You’ll need coconut oil, ground turkey, Chino Valley Ranchers eggs, sweet potato, baby spinach, chili powder, and garlic powder.

View the full recipe here.
